intro: Siphocampylus arachnes, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are opposite and often have a rough texture, while its flowers are clustered in terminal spikes. Siphocampylus arachnes is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
